IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION THROUGH EXECUTIVE TRAINING PROGRAMS & PUBLICATION & DISTRIBUTION OF TEACHING MATERIALS TO SUPPORT IBS at UWO & other educational institutions.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION THROUGH EXECUTIVE TRAINING PROGRAMS AND THE PUBLICATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF TEACHING MATERIALS TO SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR THE IVEY BUSINESS SCHOOL AT THE UNIVERSITY OF WESTERN ONTARIO AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS.
IRS990.Desc: Ivey Academy - The Ivey Academy provides leadership development programs: it is a full service Learning and Development house, providing university-based executive education with talent assessment, strategy, and behaviour change sustainment. Programs and services delivered include individual and custom training programs (in-person and virtual), learning and development advisory services, talent assessments, coaching and corporate retreats.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Conference Centres - Ivey's two conference facilities, based in London and Toronto (Ontario), provide classrooms, accommodations, meeting rooms and food and beverages to Ivey's degree programs and non-degree programs (Ivey Academy) participants as well as to other organizations and the general public.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Ivey Publishing - Ivey Publishing provides business case studies to academic communities, supporting management education around the world. Case writing and case teaching workshops are also provided by Ivey Publishing.

OtherExpensesGrp.Desc: COST OF SALES, IVEY TRADING CO

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO of Ivey Business School Foundation is the Dean of Ivey Business School and an employee of the University of Western Ontario (UWO); compensation is determined by UWO following defined policies and approved by UWO's Board of Governors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PARt I, LINEs 5 and 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Ivey Business School Foundation has an incentive program for its key employees. The incentive program is tied to both revenue and profit. A portion of the incentive is tied to the Ivey Performance Scorecard, which includes meeting budgeted surplus for Ivey and its companies.

Officers, Directors and Trustees listed in Part VII who cannot be reached at Ivey's mailing address: Director name Mailng Address Patrick Crowley 1001-111 Forsythe Street, Oakville, Ontario L6K 3J9 Dan Ross 506 West Edith Cavell Boulevard, Port Stanley, Ontario N6K 4Z7 Martin Thrasher 602-250 Sydenham Street, London, Ontario N6A 5S1 Robert Siskind 1498 Stoneybrook Crescent, London, Ontario N5X 1C5 Marlene McGrath 67 Sports Field Cres, London, Ontario N6K 4K2 Craig Gilchrist 8 Governors Road, Toronto, Ontario, M4W 2G1

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Working papers are prepared using supporting papers for the financial statements of Ivey Business School Foundation and submitted to KPMG as support to fill in the tax return. The completed return is reviewed and approved by Ivey Business School Foundation's CFO and then reviewed and signed by the CFO. KPMG files the signed return with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Ivey Business School Foundation follows the Universtiy of Western Ontario's policies, including Western's conflict of interest policy. The Foundation's Human Resources and Finance staff members ensure compliance with Western's policies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO of Ivey Business School Foundation is the Dean of Ivey Business School and an employee of the University of Western Ontario (UWO); compensation is determined by UWO following defined policies and approved by UWO's Board of Governors. Salary bands of all staff are determined by human resources in consultation with external compensation specialties; established criteria are used by human resources to determine compensation of all staff including senior management and key employees of the organization and is approved by the Dean and key members of the Executive Committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization follows Western's policies which are available to the public on their website. The organization is a registered charity, required to annually file a T3010 charity return which includes a copy of the organization's audited financial statements; the financial information is available to the public on the Canada Revenue Agency's website of the charities directorate.
